snippet: A federal judge said a conservative group could coordinate with political candidates on “issue advocacy.”
abstract: Judge Rudolph T Randa of Federal District Court in Wisconsin rules that groups may coordinate with political campaigns on 'issue advocacy,' allowing conservative group Citizens for Responsible Government Advocates Inc to work with three candidates seeking state legislative and county-level posts; ruling reverses more restrictive interpretation of existing state law.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge said a conservative group could coordinate with political candidates on “issue advocacy.”

keywords.value: Citizens for Responsible Government Advocates Inc
keywords.name: organizations
